items.sentence: I never for a moment imagined we wouldn\'t get home before the storm hit.
I want to find out if Tom is going to wear the new shirt that I gave him.
Someone famous said that imagination is more important than intelligence.
Tom has two brothers. One lives in Boston and the other lives in Chicago.
If Tom had been a little more patient, he would\'ve been able to do that.
Is there any chance that Tom might have gone to Mary\'s house last night?
I can\'t believe that you\'re eating what the doctor told you not to eat.
I haven\'t heard anything from him since then. I wonder what he\'s up to.
Tom pressed a button, but nothing happened, so he pressed another button.
Tom removed the hacksaw from his toolbox and asked Mary if she wanted it.
Tom said that he thought Mary knew who John hoped would win the election.
Tom seems to have a lot of fun trying to cause as much trouble as he can.
Tom soon discovered that he knew more about science than his teacher did.
I thought Tom wouldn\'t tell the teacher that I hadn\'t done my homework.
Tom said he wanted to drop in on some old friends while he was in Boston.
Tom was shocked to hear that Mary had been injured in a traffic accident.
Tom could\'ve saved me a lot of time if he\'d told me about that earlier.
The waitress flirted with Tom thinking that he\'d leave her a larger tip.
Tom can\'t account for his whereabouts on the day that Mary was murdered.
We have to consider the possibility that Tom was involved in the robbery.
